definition: to have no interest in sth
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
to search/to demand/to ask/to exact/large rope/isolated
surname Suo/abbr. for 索馬里|索马里[Suo3 ma3 li3], Somalia

sentences.english: If he was absent for even an hour, they seemed to lose their gaiety .
sentences.chinese: 如果他有一个小时不在，他们仿佛也会意兴索然。

sentences.english: Trinket's elation quickly vanished and he went off disconsolately to change back into his eunuch's uniform.
sentences.chinese: 韦小宝登时意兴索然，便去换了小太监的服色。

sentences.english: Your letters are full of things that do not interest me.
sentences.chinese: 你的来信中充满着令我意兴索然的物事。

definition: to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
as if one had lost something (idiom)/to look or feel unsettled or distracted/to feel empty
to laugh involuntarily/Taiwan pr. [e4 ran2 shi1 xiao4]
long moan and short gasp (idiom); continually moaning and groaning in pain
